definition: Sun Shan, Song Dynasty joker and talented scholar
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)

sentences.english: When Sun Shan arrived home, all the villagers came to congratulate him.
sentences.chinese: 孙山回家后，乡亲们都来看他，向他祝贺。

definition: lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
to fail an exam
first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
provincial imperial examination graduate who ranked 1st in metropolitan examination (in Ming and Qing dynasties)
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
candidate who ranked 1st in imperial examination on prefecture or county level (in Ming and Qing dynasties)
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
imperial examinations
to sit for imperial examinations
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
